page.title: 19Changes During Living Memory
page.content: After interviews with senior Dentonians children in the Primary School found that life continually changes while the countryside remains much the same.House prices which were as little as a few hundred pounds in 1940 are now thousands of pounds, so expensive infact that many local young couples can't afford to buy them and have to move away from the area they love. Transport which consisted of at least one bus a day to Kendal, is now one bus a week on Market Day.Infact if it wasn't for Mr Burrow,with his taxis some people would never go out of Dent. There are fewer shops now than in the 1940's then there was a butcher a baker and a shoemaker.More people own cars today.We are fortunate to have an excellent garage in Dent.
